pullRequest.body:
This allows hypotheses to be removed from the set of generalized hypotheses. E.g. `wlog h : P replacing h'` will remove `h'` from the hypotheses of the type of `this` and from the context of the goal that will suppose `h`. See [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/wlog.20.2E.2E.2E.20replacing.20.2E.2E.2E.3F).

---

nodes.body: I'm sorry I missed your message back then. I'm going to merge `master` and test it now.

@urkud Ah, no problem! I'd forgotten about thisâ€”I've updated the test (missing import) so it should pass CI again. Thanks for merging `master`; feel free to let me know about any failures/unexpected behavior. :)

EDIT: I noticed a bug where this feature would let you do something it shouldn't, and made sure an error was thrown instead; see tests.

pullRequest.title: feat: `wlog ... replacing`

@urkud Ah, no problem! I'd forgotten about thisâ€”I've updated the test (missing import) so it should pass CI again. Thanks for merging `master`; feel free to let me know about any failures/unexpected behavior. :)

EDIT: I noticed a bug where this feature would let you do something it shouldn't, and made sure an error was thrown instead; see tests.
